data.event: The county was formed in 1820; and named for James Monroe the fifth President, author of the Monroe Doctrine.
Confederate Gen. John Hunt Morgan's first Kentucky raid occurred here on July 9, 1862.

event.title: served two terms as constable of Cumberland County in 1802

data.event: President Abraham Lincoln's half third cousin, Thomas Lincoln (1780â€“1844), lived in the Meshack Creek area of present-day Monroe County and served two terms as constable of Cumberland County in 1802 and 1804.
In 1810 he left Kentucky and migrated to Ohio and Indiana.
In 1799 he married Patsy Gee from Meshack Creek.
